formula: a(n) = 2*a(n-1) - 2*a(n-4) + a(n-5) (holds at least up to n = 40000 but is not known to hold in general).
mathematica: RecurrenceTable[{a[0] == 5, a[1] == 9, a[n] == Floor[a[n - 1]^2/a[n - 2]]}, a, {n, 0, 40}] (* _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 04 2016 *)
prog: (MAGMA) Iv:=[5, 9]; [n le 2 select Iv[n] else Floor(Self(n-1)^2/Self(n-2)): n in [1..40]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 04 2016
crossrefs: See A008776 for definitions of Pisot sequences.
author: _David W. Wilson_
extensions: Deleted unproved recurrence and program based on it. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 04 2016
